thread.title: Samsung Head Indicted on Bribery Charges in South Korea
thread.title_full: Samsung Head Indicted on Bribery Charges in South Korea

author: CHOE SANG-HUN
title: Samsung Head Indicted on Bribery Charges in South Korea
text: Lee Jae-yong, the de facto leader of Samsung, one of the world’s largest conglomerates, was indicted on charges of bribery   becoming one of the most prominent business tycoons to stand trial in South Korea. Mr. Lee’s indictment came at the end of a special prosecutor’s 90-day investigation of a corruption scandal that had already   Mr. Lee was arrested on Feb. 17. Mr. Lee was accused of giving or promising Choi Soon-sil, a secretive confidante of President Park, a total of $38 million in bribes, including thoroughbred horses for Ms. Choi’s daughter, an equestrian. In return, Mr. Lee received political favors, most notably government support for a merger of two Samsung affiliates in 2015 that helped him inherit corporate control from his incapacitated father, Lee Kun-hee, the Samsung chairman, the prosecutor said in his indictment. Mr. Lee was also accused of committing perjury when he insisted during a parliamentary hearing that he never bribed Ms. Choi or Ms. Park. He still claims that the “donations” Samsung paid out to Ms. Choi were coerced, suggesting that the company was extorted.
